reviewText: My only regret is that this is not available in blu-ray and since it was 2005 you can see the difference in resolution when you watch it on a high definition TV Set (especially a larger than 37'' set), but if you're already prepared for that - as I was - then that's fine, you can get passed it (because the quality is still rather good) and watch an amazing show - one of the best Gack performances with great editing and smooth transition between DVDs, The menu is amazing with an endless loop of 'Ash' which I can listen to forever and the sound quality is sharp.
